name: 柯俊宏
objective:
Course Description:
The laser is one of the most groundbreaking inventions of the 20th century, revolutionizing numerous fields, especially medicine. This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the principles and practical applications of lasers in medical and dental settings.

Students will explore both theoretical foundations and real-world use cases of medical lasers, with emphasis on laser-tissue interaction, safety protocols, and clinical procedures. The course also includes hands-on training and live demonstrations to reinforce practical skills.

Key Topics Include:

Fundamentals of Laser Physics
Laser Safety Standards and Regulations
Laser-Tissue Interaction Mechanisms
Medical and Dental Laser Applications
Laser Use in Periodontology
Surgical Applications in Oral and Maxillofacial Procedures
Laser-Assisted Teeth Whitening (Bleaching)
Low-Level Laser Therapy (LLLT) and Photobiomodulation
Practical Hands-on Sessions and Live Clinical Demonstrations
